backend/main.mo: Defines an empty Motoko actor, serving as a placeholder backend with no logic implemented.
feature_evidence.json: Feature evidence report documenting four outro-related frontend features, their affected files, component dependencies, test requirements, and confidence levels.
frontend-file-summaries.txt: Prewritten high-level summaries of key frontend source files, describing application flow, game mechanics, intro/outro behavior, and styling infrastructure.
frontend/index.css: Global Tailwind CSS setup defining design tokens, light/dark theme variables, chart colors, and base element styling.
frontend/index.html: HTML entry point that mounts the React app and loads the Vite-powered main TypeScript bundle.
frontend/src/App.tsx: Root React component managing a three-phase state machine (intro, game, outro) and switching views based on completion callbacks.
frontend/src/content/story.ts: Centralized story configuration defining intro narrative steps, goal blocks, slider question, statistics, and Donald’s two-part narrative for staged reveal.
frontend/src/features/game/CollectiblesH: HUD component displaying the number of collected stars out of the total using a styled star icon and counter.
frontend/src/features/game/GameView.tsx: Main game component implementing a top-down collectible game with movement, camera tracking, collisions, modals, jokes, collectibles logic, and outro trigger on final star dismissal.
frontend/src/features/game/GoalsModal.ts: Modal dialog introducing Donald’s goals and game objective, dismissible via a Continue button or Escape key.
frontend/src/features/game/jokes.ts: Exports a static array of lighthearted goal-related joke strings used elsewhere in the game.
frontend/src/features/game/MobilePhoneMo: Empty file reserved for a future modal component related to the mobile phone collectible.
frontend/src/features/game/passability.t: Utility module defining corridor passability rules, guaranteed traversal channel geometry, and collision checks to ensure obstacles never block the playable path.
frontend/src/features/game/SpeechBalloon: UI component that renders an animated speech balloon positioned above the character while staying within canvas bounds.
frontend/src/features/game/StarPickupMod: React modal component shown when picking up a star, with title/description, optional completion message, Escape key handling, and a Continue button to dismiss.
frontend/src/features/game/useGameLoop.t: Custom React hook that runs a requestAnimationFrame game loop and calls an onUpdate callback with delta time each frame.
frontend/src/features/game/useKeyboardCo: Custom hook that tracks arrow-key movement state and handles Space and J key actions, with support for disabling input.
frontend/src/features/game/worldMap.ts: Defines world map types and generates a randomized, guaranteed-passable corridor path with collision helpers and corridor boundary checks.
frontend/src/features/intro/GoalStickine: Intro UI component presenting a slider-based question with feedback, delayed Continue button, and submission handling.
frontend/src/features/intro/introBackgro: Provides functions to compute dynamic background gradients that darken progressively during the intro and a final terminal gradient.
frontend/src/features/intro/IntroFlow.ts: Manages the multi-stage introductory narrative flow, timed text reveals, background gradient transitions, and progression to game start.
frontend/src/features/outro/OutroFlow.ts: Implements a multi-stage outro narrative with timed text reveals, continue buttons, and a final takeaway selection flow, coordinating UI state across several outro text blocks.
frontend/src/features/outro/TakeawayModa: Defines a modal dialog for displaying an individual takeaway, with overlay, escape-key handling, close actions, and placeholder informational content.
frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts: Provides a React Query hook that creates and caches a backend actor based on the current Internet Identity, recreating and invalidating dependent queries when identity changes.
frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.t: Implements an authentication context and provider for DFINITY Internet Identity, handling login, logout, persisted identities, and exposing detailed login status flags.
frontend/src/index.css: Sets up Tailwind base styles, CSS variables for light and dark themes, global typography, and custom utility classes like animations and pixelated rendering.
frontend/src/main.tsx: Bootstraps the React application by rendering the App component wrapped with React Query and Internet Identity providers and importing global styles.
frontend/tailwind.config.js: Configures Tailwind CSS with dark mode, content paths, design tokens mapped to CSS variables, custom animations, and additional plugins.
project_state.json: Project metadata describing a React + TypeScript SPA with a staged, story-driven intro that transitions into a linear top-down canvas game, then back into an outro narrative. It documents existing features, including the intro state machine, timed narrative reveals, mood-darkening gradients, gameplay mechanics, collectibles flow, and scaffolding for ICP authentication and build tooling.
